title: ICE: using `lazy-regex` to replace HTML with regex

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust use lazy_regex::{regex, Captures}; fn replace_html(html: &str) -> String { let re = regex!(r"(?i)
|||

"); re.replace_all(html, |caps: Captures| { match caps.get(0).unwrap().as_str().to_lowercase().as_str() { "" | "

" => "\n", _ => "\n", } }) .to_string() } fn main() { let html = "






content

"; let replaced_html = replace_html(&html); println!("Replaced HTML:\n{}", replaced_html); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.1 (8460ca823 2023-03-20) binary: rustc commit-hash: 8460ca823e8367a30dda430efda790588b8c84d3 commit-date: 2023-03-20 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.1 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling ice v0.1.0 (/home/satvik/Projects/Rust/ice) error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/region_constraints/mod.rs:568:17: cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 0, kind: BrNamed(DefId(0:11 ~ ice[18ab]::replace_html::'_), '_) }) <= ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 1, kind: BrNamed(DefId(23:3266 ~ regex[3da8]::re_unicode::{impl#36}::'_#1), '_) }) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/8460ca823e8367a30dda430efda790588b8c84d3/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:987:33 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f2a4467259a -
